title: 111_s3132
content: The Act is titled the "Exemplary Breastfeeding Support Act" and includes provisions for supporting breastfeeding in the WIC program. The Child Nutrition Act of 1966 is amended to include provisions for supplemental foods, nutrition education, and breastfeeding promotion and support through eligible local agencies. The Secretary is required to consult on these requirements. The Child Nutrition Act of 1966 is amended to include provisions for breastfeeding promotion and support through eligible local agencies. The Secretary is required to annually compile and publish breastfeeding performance measurements based on program participant data. The Child Nutrition Act of 1966 is amended to include provisions for breastfeeding promotion and support through eligible local agencies. Local agencies must implement programs to recognize exemplary breastfeeding support practices and provide performance bonuses to State agencies achieving the highest proportion of participating breastfed infants. The Secretary evaluates exemplary breastfeeding support practices by considering performance measurements, effectiveness of peer counselor programs, and partnerships with other entities to create a supportive breastfeeding environment for participating women. The Secretary provides performance bonus payments to State agencies with the highest proportion of participating breastfed infants or the greatest improvement in breastfeeding rates. The Secretary provides performance bonus payments to State agencies based on the proportion of participating fully breastfed infants they serve. State agencies receiving a bonus must treat the funds as program funds and may transfer them. The Secretary provides performance bonuses to State agencies for serving fully breastfed infants, allowing funds to be transferred to local agencies for program use. Implementation includes revising criteria for awarding bonuses within a year of enactment. Amendments to the Child Nutrition Act of 1966 include provisions for breast pumps.
